remarks: Generalize ~ isercoll so that both sequences have arbitrary starting point.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Apr-2015.)
statement:
isercoll2.z $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
isercoll2.w $e |- W = ( ZZ>= ` N ) $.
isercoll2.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
isercoll2.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. ZZ ) $.
isercoll2.g $e |- ( ph -> G : Z --> W ) $.
isercoll2.i $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( G ` k ) < ( G ` ( k + 1 ) ) ) $.
isercoll2.0 $e |- ( ( ph /\ n e. ( W \ ran G ) ) -> ( F ` n ) = 0 ) $.
isercoll2.f $e |- ( ( ph /\ n e. W ) -> ( F ` n ) e. CC ) $.
isercoll2.h $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( H ` k ) = ( F ` ( G ` k ) ) ) $.
isercoll2 $p |- ( ph -> ( seq M ( + , H ) ~~> A <-> seq N ( + , F ) ~~> A ) ) $.
$d A k n $.
$d F k n $.
$d G k n $.
$d H k n $.
$d M k n $.
$d N n $.
$d W n $.
$d Z k $.
$d k n ph $.
